item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Worship, Arts, Media Our weekly worship at Hope is modern, enjoyable and very uplifting. We have an entire team of talented, gifted and dedicated musicians and singers each week, who love God and love to serve their local church. If you are a musician, singer, computer expert, video, audio, choir or drama person and you would like to get involved there is always a spot for team players at Hope Church. *Drummer *PA * Visual > Please click on Contact us and Att to Jessica Prayer Our intercessory team is made up of a group of vibrant people coming from different age groups. We meet every Sunday morning to intercede for our church, our city and the lost. We come together because we firmly believe God is faithful to all His promises and we are passionate to see His kingdom come and His will be done on earth. God is looking for people who have faith and are willing to stand in gap for the lost. If you want to find out more or are interested in joining our intercessory team. Please click on Contact us and Att to Angela. Editorial The communicative power of word and image has long

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We are one of the centers of Hope Christian Church Melbourne, under the leadership of the Senior Pastor, Dr Ian Foley. The other centers are Waverley, Frankston & Darebin. We also belong to the family of Hope churches around the world, under Hope International Ministries. Website http://www.byhim.org/

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: These are the values that we hold dearly. We desire to build communities of people with lifestyle and culture that reflect such values. CHRIST CENTERED Christ is central to who we are and what we do. We are passionate about our relationship with Christ; submitting to His Lordship and in growing to be like Christ. HOLY SPIRIT EMPOWERED We believe in the importance of being Spirit-filled and Spirit-led. We emphasise reliance on the Holy Spirit in every facet of our personal and church life. BIBLE BASED The Bible is the foundational authority for faith and practice. We emphasise expository preaching and balanced comprehensive practical teaching so that our members may understand, live out and mature in the Christian life as God intended. COVENANTAL RELATIONSHIPS God is a covenantal God. He seeks people who are committed to Him and His purpose, and with one another. We believe an appropriate response to Gods covenant involves loving, honouring and worshipping Him above all else. We seek to develop covenantal relationships among believers through committing to love and build up one another. ENRICHING COMMUNITY LIFE We are committed to being a life-enriching community. We are committed to building an authentic and biblical community that

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: 1. The Bible We believe in every word of the Old and New Testaments as originally given, and that God inspired humans to write it without error. The Bible is the Word of God. It is the absolute truth and therefore is the standard of faith as well as the ultimate handbook for every aspect in a believers life. 2. God We believe in the one true and eternal God, the Creator of everything. God is one but exists in three persons: the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit. Though they are co-equal, coexistent and co-eternal, they play different roles in human history, working together in creation, revelation, redemption and the final judgment. 3. Jesus Christ We believe in Jesus Christ, the Son of God, who was supernaturally conceived by the power of the Holy Spirit and born of the Virgin Mary. Whilst on earth, He was both perfectly God and perfectly man at the same time, and was without sin. He was crucified on the cross and physically rose from the dead on the third day to fulfil the will of the Father to provide salvation from sin to those who believe in Him. He ascended physically to

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: What is Life Group? Life Group is our small group meeting that happens weekly or fortnightly, on weeknights. Life Group is casual & relational, usually in home setting. Life Group is about exchanging life experiences, sharing testimonies of what God is doing in our lives, and showing love to one another. Life Group is a place to meet people from the similar life phases, e.g youths, students, young adults and families. Life Group Details Wednesday Young Adults Life Group 1 Thursday Young Adults Life Group 3 Friday Student Life Group RMIT Student Life Group Melbourne Uni Young Adults Life Group 2 Family Life Group West 1 Family Life Group West 2 Family Life Group East 1 Sunday Youth Group * (For contact details, please contact FC Wong on mobile 0416 537 148 or email fcwong2027@yahoo.co.uk)

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Hi, its a pleasure to have you visit our website! What are we on about at our church? Encountering Jesus and His mercy leads every thirsty soul to treasure Him like a dry, parched desert receiving drenching spring rains. Thats our experience and joy. There is a wonderful pleasure and security in making the one who paid for our sins, the Lord of our lives. He makes our lives evergreen! Through Jesus our church is making a difference by simply doing the things, Jesus plainly said to do. E.g. loving others & sharing life, empowering others from wisdom gained by applying the cross personally, bringing my Jesus values of love and care into the market place, being known in our community as a good Samaritan etc (Matthew 28:18-20) Jesus bridges heaven to earth. The Spirit of God is here and will lead us to reveal our heavenly Fathers love and the hope of His coming kingdom to spread throughout this city and abroad to all nations. Thats our heart. We humbly invite you to visit and be a part of our lives and vision.

item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Hi,   it's a pleasure to have you visit our website! We welcome you to Hope! What are we on about at our church? Encountering Jesus and His mercy leads every thirsty soul to treasure Him like a dry, parched desert receiving drenching spring rains.   That's our experience and joy. There is a wonderful pleasure and security in making the one who paid for our sins, the Lord of our lives. He makes our lives evergreen! Through Jesus our church is making a difference by simply doing the things, Jesus plainly said to do.E.g. loving others & sharing life, empowering others from wisdom gained by applying the cross personally, bringing my Jesus' values of love and care into the market place, being known in our community as a good Samaritan etc... (Matthew 28:18-20)   Jesus bridges heaven to earth. The Spirit of God is here and will lead us to reveal our heavenly Father's love and the hope of His coming kingdom to spread throughout this city and abroad to all nations.   That's our heart. We humbly invite you to visit and be a part of our lives and vision. God bless you,   HOPE - Melbourne City Centre

item.title: Our Ministries
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Looking to Serve in Hope Christian Church?

At Hope Christian Church, we believe that every Christian is a minister of Gods word and His works as stated in 1 Peter 2:9. With that, all our members are encouraged to be active in Christian service. GET INVOLVED TODAY!

PRAISE and WORSHIP Ministry

The worship ministry is a dynamic and passionate group of musicians and technical crew who contribute to the vibrant celebration services every week. PA Back up singing Worship leading

KIDS FOR CHRIST (Children) Ministry

The KFC Childrens Ministry aims to provide age appropriate teaching on the foundations of the Christian Faith in a contemporary, relevant and fun style to raise them up in the things of God, so they will come to know, love and serve our Heavenly Father.

RECEPTION Ministry

Every week, the reception team is at the forefront of the church, being the first people to extend warmth and love to all who come to the church. Other responsibilities include Communion, Tithes and Ushering.

item.title: Get Connected
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
We warmly invite you to our Life Groups and get connected with our friendly communities!

What is Life Group?

  • Life Group is our small group meeting that happens weekly or fortnightly, on weeknights.
  • Life Group is casual & relational, usually in home setting.
  • Life Group is about exchanging life experiences, sharing testimonies of what God is doing in our lives, and showing love to one another.
  • Life Group is a place to meet people from the similar life phases, e.g youths, students, young adults and families.

Wednesday

  • Young Adults Life Group 1 - Jimmy | jmekdara@hotmail.com | 0410 095 100

Thursday

  • Young Adults Life Group 3 - Dara | dara_c@hotmail.com | 0403 433 074

Friday

  • Student Life Group: SALTS - Stefanus | stefanus.i@gmail.com | 0419 809 580
  • Young Adults Life Group 2 - Angela | aycwong6@gmail.com | 0402 258 149
  • Family Life Group West 1 - Alan & Jessie | alan_c_ho@yahoo.com.au | 0402 090 060

Saturday

  • Family Life Group South East - Carlo & Phylice | hopemelbcityoperations@gmail.com | 0422 383 415
  • Family Life Group West 2 - James & Glory | jogyong@gmail.com | 0413 911 124

item.title: Pastoral Team
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Mark Rusic Centre Pastor Matthew Wong Assistant Pastor

item.title: Statement of Faith
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Statement of Faith


1. The Bible We believe in every word of the Old and New Testaments as originally given, and that God inspired humans to write it without error. The Bible is the Word of God. It is the absolute truth and therefore is the standard of faith as well as the ultimate handbook for every aspect in a believer's life. 2. God We believe in the one true and eternal God, the Creator of everything. God is one but exists in three persons: the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit. Though they are co-equal, coexistent and co-eternal, they play different roles in human history, working together in creation, revelation, redemption and the final judgment. 3. Jesus Christ We believe in Jesus Christ, the Son of God, who was supernaturally conceived by the power of the Holy Spirit and born of the Virgin Mary. Whilst on earth, He was both perfectly God and perfectly man at the same time, and was without sin. He was crucified on the cross and physically rose from the dead on the third day to fulfil the will of the Father to provide salvation from sin to those who believe in Him. He ascended physically to heaven and is seated at the right hand of the Father. One day in the future, He will come again to establish His kingdom. 4. The Holy Spirit We believe that the Holy Spirit is God who convicts people of sin and leads them to repent of their sin and place their faith in Jesus for salvation. He dwells within believers to enable them to lead holy lives and obey God's will. We believe that all the gifts of the Holy Spirit mentioned in the Bible remain in the Church today and should be fully exercised to build up the Body of Christ. The baptism of the Holy Spirit, an experience distinct from repentance and faith in Jesus for salvation, enables Christians to testify of Christ in the power of the Spirit. Speaking in tongues is the normal initial sign of being baptised in the Holy Spirit. In the Christian life, every believer must live in obedience to Christ and be under the covering of the Holy Spirit. Christians should always be filled with the Spirit. 5. Angels, Satan and God's Plan We believe God created angelic beings for His service. They are supernatural but not divine. The Bible teaches that Satan, together with the many angels that follow him, are evil, supernatural, angelic beings and that there is a spiritual kingdom on earth under Satan's authority opposed to God and His plan. Satan's kingdom is at war with God's kingdom. The death and resurrection of Jesus on the cross defeated Satan and enables all men and women who put their trust in Jesus to join God's kingdom. The Church has been commissioned to rescue men and women from Satan's kingdom to God's, a task which will conclude when Jesus returns. God will ultimately triumph when Satan's rule is terminated and his kingdom destroyed. 6. Man We believe that God created man in His likeness and without sin but they sinned willingly. As a consequence, sin entered the world and all mankind has inherited a sinful nature. Since everyone has fallen short of God's standard because of sin and is subject to God's wrath and condemnation, they all need His salvation which is made possible through the death of Jesus Christ; otherwise they will be judged and punished eternally in hell. 7. Salvation We believe that we can be saved from God's wrath when we confess and repent from sin and place our trust in Jesus Christ. Salvation is given by the grace of God only on the basis of Jesus' sacrifice for sin when He died on the cross and cannot be achieved by a person's own works. At the point of salvation, an individual becomes a new creation in Christ. Through obedience and faith a Christian is gradually transformed to become more like Jesus. 8. The Church We believe that the church is the community of God's people and central to God's plan of salvation. Once we become Christians, we are adopted into God's family and become part of the Universal Church, made up of Christians of every age. Local churches are made up of believers who regularly meet together in different localities to worship, listen to the Word of God, fellowship, witness, participate in communion, pray and have other activities together. We believe that every Christian should be committed to a local church. 9. Eternal Judgement We believe that the dead will be raised and everyone will have to give account before God. All those who have put their faith in God will receive their reward and live eternally with God in heaven. On the Day of Judgment the remainder will be judged and receive eternal punishment in hell. 10. Baptism and Communion We believe that all Christians should be water baptised in obedience to Jesus' command and as a public testimony of their commitment to follow Him. Water baptism is the immersion of a person completely in water as a symbol of the death, burial and resurrection of Jesus. Communion is for Christians to remember Jesus by partaking of bread and wine as symbols of the flesh and blood of Jesus and the covenant God has made to bring salvation through faith in Christ. It is practiced in obedience to the command of Jesus and can be celebrated as often as believers gather together until Jesus returns. 11. Worship We believe that Christians must worship the Lord in spirit and in truth. Worship is acknowledging the worthiness of God and opening our hearts to relate to Him. Worshipping according to Biblical patterns allows us to use outward expression to come close to God. Some of these expressions of worship include worshipping with other Christians, using musical instruments, singing and exercising the gifts of the Holy Spirit. 12. Healing We believe it is normally God's will for all mankind to be whole and healthy both physically and spiritually. The Church is vested with the authority of Jesus Christ to bring a ministry of healing in every possible way that is both through the power of God and through medical knowledge and expertise as part of the manifestation of the love of God for all mankind which God desires to bring through His church.

item.title: Core Values
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Core Values

These are the values that we hold dearly. We desire to build communities of people with lifestyle and culture that reflect such values.

CHRIST CENTERED Christ is central to who we are and what we do. We are passionate about our relationship with Christ; submitting to His Lordship and in growing to be like Christ. HOLY SPIRIT EMPOWERED We believe in the importance of being Spirit-filled and Spirit-led. We emphasise reliance on the Holy Spirit in every facet of our personal and church life. BIBLE BASED The Bible is the foundational authority for faith and practice. We emphasise expository preaching and balanced comprehensive practical teaching so that our members may understand, live out and mature in the Christian life as God intended. COVENANTAL RELATIONSHIPS God is a covenantal God. He seeks people who are committed to Him and His purpose, and with one another. We believe an appropriate response to Gods covenant involves loving, honouring and worshipping Him above all else. We seek to develop covenantal relationships among believers through committing to love and build up one another. ENRICHING COMMUNITY LIFE We are committed to being a life-enriching community. We are committed to building an authentic and biblical community that unconditionally loves and effectively enfolds people of all cultures and backgrounds. VISION DRIVEN We believe in the importance of a God-given, biblical vision that requires nothing less than our obedience to fulfilling the entirety of Gods vision for the church. We are passionate with the vision to fulfil the Great Commission by raising Christ-centred disciples to plant vibrant biblical churches in all nations in the world that will impact every sphere of human endeavour for Christ. DISCIPLE MAKING We are dedicated to developing and multiplying fully devoted disciples with Christ-like attitudes, values and Kingdom-focused lifestyles. We aim to raise disciples that are passionate about Jesus, people and the Great Commission. LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT We believe that every Christ follower has leadership potential. We are committed to equipping and training to raise quality leaders to impact the world for Christ. CHURCH PLANTING Every believer has a part to play in reaching our communities and every nation with the Gospel. Our world missions strategy is to plant vibrant biblical churches in every nation. We are committed to empowering members to share their faith and impact their communities. We believe that every believer has a part to play in world-missions. APOSTOLIC ORIENTATED God uses five-fold ministries: apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors and teachers to mature the Church to the fullest extent. An apostolic movement incorporating the five-fold ministry is Gods plan for the end-time Church.

item.title: Affiliations
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We are one of the centers of Hope Christian Church Melbourne, under the leadership of the Senior Pastor, Dr Ian Foley. The other sister centers are Waverley, Frankston & Darebin. We also belong to the family of Hope churches around the world, under Hope International Ministries. Hope International Ministries - http://www.byhim.org/ Hope Melbourne Waverley Centre - http://www.hopemelbourne.com/ Hope Melbourne Frankston Centre - http://www.hopemelbourne.com/frankston/ Hope Melbourne Darebin Centre - http://hopedarebin.blogspot.com/

item.title: Ministries
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
In Hope Melbourne City Centre, we have ministries that work together to build God's kingdom. Click on the link below to see what these ministries are about.
  • Worship, Arts, Media
  • Prayer
  • Editorial
  • Ladies Fellowship
  • Hospitality
  • Welcoming team
  • Community Outreach
  • Kids for Christ (Childrens) Ministry

Worship, Arts, Media

Our weekly worship at Hope is modern, enjoyable and very uplifting. We have an entire team of talented, gifted and dedicated musicians and singers each week, who love God and love to serve their local church.

If you are a musician, singer, computer expert, video, audio, choir or drama person and you would like to get involved there is always a spot for team players at Hope Church. *Drummer *PA * Visual.

Please email "wamhccm@gmail.com" Att to Ps Matthew Check out Hopes WAM page here

Prayer

Our intercessory team is made up of a group of vibrant people coming from different age groups. We meet every Sunday morning to intercede for our church, our city and the lost. We come together because we firmly believe God is faithful to all His promises and we are passionate to see His kingdom come and His will be done on earth.

God is looking for people who have faith and are willing to stand in gap for the lost. If you want to find out more or are interested in joining our intercessory team, Please email "fcwong2027@yahoo.co.uk" and Att to Angela.

Editorial

The communicative power of word and image has long been used to spread the good news of the kingdom of God

Even with the recent technological revolution of media and Internet, word and image are still the cornerstone of communication. At Hope Editorial, it is our passion to bring to you weekly updates of members testimonies; photographic records of our various events; inspiring articles which will encourage and spur us all together; artistic submission of drawings, poems or photographs by our own members etc.

It is our hope that through the creative use of word and image, the kingdom of God will be further advanced. If God has given you a passion in this area, well love to have you on board! Checkout examples of our weekly editorial OR to find out how you can contribute,

Please email hopeeditorial@gmail.com Att to Pei Wah

Ladies Fellowship

Ladies Fellowship is a regular get together of women in our church to provide encouragement and dynamic fellowship for women young and old in song, in word, fun activities and fine food.

Our women are very creative and are keen to try out different activities. Some of our activities include: women related sharing, cooking & baking lesson, flower arrangements, and ocassional field trips.

Our prayer is that each women who came would be refreshed, encouraged and built up

Please email "hccmcclf@gmail.com" Att to Susan

Hospitality

Everybody loves to eat! Nothings better than to fellowship with one another while we enjoying our food.

Our Hospitality Ministry is for those who cook and prepare meals for Sunday service lunch and any special occasion within our church.

Our objective is to create different, hearty, seasonal dishes that will bring smile and joy to our members. Our Food cooked with 2 most important ingredients LOVE and PASSION.

If you passionate about food, lets turn on the heat & cook from your HEART!!!

Please email "fcwong2027@yahoo.co.uk" Att to Christine

Welcoming team

We are a young and vibrant ministry seeking to welcome everyone into the House of the Lord. "Accept one another, then, just as Christ accepted you, in order to bring praise to God" Romans 15:7.

Our mission statement is to make new visitors feel welcome in a family of HOPE!

Besides our friendly smiles, we want to be able to provide a high level of service to the Lord in the collection of His tithes and offerings.

Our aim is for everyone in the church be a part of this great ministry, young or old, student or working, single or with family

ALL is welcome! Please email "fcwong2027@yahoo.co.uk" Att to Anna

Community Outreach

Matthew 25:40
"The King will reply, 'I tell you the truth, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers of mine, you did for me"

If you are interested in joining us and seeing how the Church can play apart in serving the local community through various practical means:

Please email "outreach.him@gmail.com" Att to Dara

Kids for Christ (Childrens) Ministry

Childrens ministry is all about helping children to know God intimately and catch the heart of Jesus.

Each week we strive to deliver fun and interesting programs to make Bible relevant in their lives.

We encourage people from across age group to be involved to help raise the next generation who will know and love God with all their hearts.

To volunteer or give us feedback, please email "hope.kfc@gmail.com" Att to James & Glory

item.title: Testimonies
item.dc:creator: pingkie_o
item.content:encoded:
Please read and be encouraged!

These are some of the Facebook testimonies by our members of their personal experience of how Gods love has changed all aspect of their lives to the better

For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future. (Jeremiah 29:11)

There are many more stories to come!

The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full. (John 10:10)

Thats what Jesus want for you! Please share your testimony with us by contacting us here!

God's timing by Ben & Susan

03 October 2013

In life, often we are waiting for something; waiting for a dream to come to pass, waiting to meet the right person, waiting for our breakthrough...we hope, wait and we prayed...we easily get frustrated when things dont happenbut we want to encourage you that your prayers have been heard...God established a time to bring His promises to pass for you too!

God use all kind of situation for the good of those who loves Him! by Jessica

28 August 2013

Run Melbourne 2013 by Benson

29 July 2013

On the 21st July 2013, I ran the 21 KM Run Melbourne and then head on to Church to worship God. It is quite a walk of faith really. If I didnt make it on time, our worship team will not have any bassist.

That morning, I completed my half marathon with the following result:

  • 10KM : 0:53:59
  • 20KM : 1:56:23
  • 21KM : 2:02:39

After limping to my car, drove to Church, served in the Worship Team and guess what? Full attendance in Church! The spirit was flowing and people were hungry to worship!

That was definitely the best day ever! The sweetness of Gods presence after a 2 hour run hardship cannot be expressed with words!

God is our provider! by John

20 March 2013

Gods miracoulous healing!! by Jessie

11 March 2013

Happy 17th Anniversary!! by Soraya

12 November 2012

"Her Name is Hope" by Shekinah production wins 2012 The Ignite Film Festival. by Christine

25 October 2012

Check it out here!

  • http://www.ignitefilmfest.com/2012-finalists.html
  • http://vimeo.com/50678943

A song inspired by The Lord to glorify HimTogether (Written by Daniel Long) by Benson

15 October 2012

Check it out here!

item.title: Hope Supernatural Ministry
item.dc:creator: Benson
item.content:encoded:
Hope School of Supernatural Ministry (HSSM) was started by Hope Auckland Christian Church in 2012 with the purpose of equipping people from Oceania in the Hope International Ministries (HIM) movement to become revivalists in their cities and their nations. We expected 20-25 students to attend but by the close of registration, we had almost 50 students. Because of God's favour and the wonderful feedback we received, we are running it again! In 2014, we will be opening the school (HSSM 1) to anyone who is hungry for revival in their city and we will be adding a follow-up school (HSSM 2) for students who graduated from the basic two-week school (2013 or 2014). There will also be an optional four-day mission trip to students who have attended HSSM 2.

Purpose

Our goal is to train up Sons and Daughters of God with a culture of revival and a lifestyle of the supernatural. There is a strong emphasis on healing, developing a prophetic culture, and demonstrating the gospel with power. At the end of the school, graduating students would carry Heaven's atmosphere back to their homes, churches and communities.

Core values

We are committed to the truth that God is good, that He loves people and that He has given His Church supernatural power to bring individuals and cities into wholeness.

item.title: Sunday Service
item.dc:creator: Benson
item.content:encoded:
What are we on about at our church? Encountering Jesus and His mercy leads every thirsty soul to treasure Him like a dry, parched desert receiving drenching spring rains.
Come join us on Sunday 10:30am at the main hall!
